newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady to lower.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady to lower.

text.p: Millfeed prices were mostly steady to lower Thursday as dealers noted sluggish demand.
"There is some better production around us and really no improvement in demand so we are finding things awfully quiet out there," a Buffalo dealer said.
Feed mixers were continuing to buy on just need basis.
The dual problems of grass and fieldwork were biting into demand, a Kansas dealer said.
He was referring to livestock feeding on grass which diminishes millfeed demand and farmers preparing their fields for corn plantings.
But nearby demand has improved in Texas, a dealer said, adding there was a small increase in feed business.
Another factor was buyers turning to cheaper substitutes.
"Other ingredients continue to ease on down," a North Carolina dealer said. "Corn is going down, hominy, gluten feed and other ingredients. Buyers are watching these substitutes very closely."
